interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Johnny Mnemonic
Review Date: 2006/05/26
Store: Keanu Reeves  (Actor),     Dolph Lundgren  (Actor),     Robert Longo  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Futuristic
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Keanu Reeves is a space-age courier who's plugged in, turned on and buffed up to deliver the most important data of the 21st century, wet-wired directly into his brain! A rapid-fire roller coaster ofaction and high-impact imagery! Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi, Ice-T, Dina Meyer and Henry Rollins.", 'Amazon.com', 'You might be tempted to call it "Johnny Moronic" after you\'ve seen this illogical and derivative adaptation of William Gibson\'s cyberpunk short story (available in his book', 'Burning Chrome', '), which is all the more depressing since Gibson himself wrote the screenplay. First you have to ask yourself why valuable top-secret electronic data would be stored in the "wet-wired" brain of a human courier (played by Keanu Reeves), who then transports the data from China to New Jersey as part of his last, most dangerous assignment. Surely there are better ways to transmit sensitive information, but since this is really just a conventional thriller with near-future design and spiffy special effects, Gibson and New York artist Robert Longo (making his directorial debut) are more interested in surface gloss and cyberpunk atmosphere. On that level the movie\'s fairly engaging, and Japanese film star Takeshi Kitano makes a pretty good villain, tracking Reeves down for the information in his data-packed brain. The movie also boasts an eclectic gallery of supporting players including rapper Ice-T, performance artist and rocker Henry Rollins, beefcake actor Dolph Lundgren, and transcontinental oddball Udo Kier. They can\'t stop this trip through virtual reality from being botched up, but sci-fi fans will certainly enjoy the echo of Gibson\'s fiction that remains on the screen.', '--Jeff Shannon']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Ice-T, Robert Longo, Cinevisions, Takeshi, Don Carmody, Keanu Reeves, Dolph Lundgren, Dina Meyer', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '2 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Robert Longo', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 25, 1997', 'Actors': 'Keanu Reeves, Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi, Ice-T, Dina Meyer', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Don Carmody', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This was a great film until the dolphin sequence appears.  How could such a great beginning end up so poorly?  Too much tuna in the writers diet, I suppose!
Review Title: dolphin nightmare!
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preference:** The user maintains a strong affinity for classic and art-house films, particularly from the UK, while recently expanding their interest to include science fiction, albeit with a critical lens on narrative coherence.
- **Format Preference:** They continue to favor physical media, especially VHS tapes, but are exploring modern formats like DVD, showing a blend of nostalgic and contemporary viewing habits.
- **Quality Focus:** The user values high-quality presentation and pristine condition, emphasizing their concern for the quality of both the media and the packaging.
- **Review Behavior:** They engage actively with products, providing detailed reviews that express enthusiasm for storytelling and noteworthy performances, albeit with a discerning eye for narrative integrity. Their recent review indicates a willingness to critique films that poorly utilize compelling premises.
- **Rating Trend:** The user exhibits a high rating trend but shows a nuanced approach with recent ratings reflecting critical assessments of films, illustrating a depth in their appreciation for storytelling.
- **Inquiry Interest:** Curiosity about film availability in various formats persists, with ongoing proactive engagement in media consumption, indicating a desire to explore diverse technological advancements in the film industry.

Overall, the user embodies the profile of a dedicated film aficionado who values quality content, tangible media formats, and narrative integrity, even as they branch into new genres.
